meanings.definition: Cross-eyed or having one eye that turns inward.
meanings.sent1: The cat had a cockeye gaze, making it look cross-eyed.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the cockeye squirrel staring at her from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The cockeye portrait on the wall seemed to follow you wherever you went.
meanings.sent4: His cockeye view of the world gave him a unique perspective on things.
meanings.sent5: The cockeye doll in the shop window caught the attention of passersby.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a suspicious cockeye when he mentioned the missing cookies.
meanings.sent2: He always gave a cockeye when he was trying to read the small print.
meanings.sent3: The cockeye from the teacher made the students giggle during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The detective's cockeye helped him spot the hidden clue in the room.
meanings.sent5: The cockeye from the old man made the children curious about his story.

meanings.definition: To look or glance sideways or askance.
meanings.sent1: She had to cockeye at the map to figure out the right direction.
meanings.sent2: He would cockeye at his friend to silently communicate during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat would cockeye at the bird outside the window, plotting its next move.
meanings.sent4: The suspect tried to cockeye away from the detective's questioning gaze.
meanings.sent5: The child would cockeye at the treats on the table, trying to resist temptation.
